# Executive summary {-}

**This report analyzes short-term rentals (STRs) in Prince Edward County (PEC), specifically as they relate to current housing conditions in the county. It first provides an overview of the housing situation in Prince Edward County, with an emphasis on property sales. It provides an overview of STRs in the county, including their type, geographic location and levels of commercial activity. It assesses the seasonality patterns of STRs, both in terms of activity and location. It measures the impact of COVID-19 on the STR market, in terms of active listings, reservations and nightly prices. It measures the impact of STRs on Prince Edward County’s housing market, particularly relating to housing affordability and availability, through an assessment of the presence of commercially-operated STRs during the high and low seasons in Prince Edward County’s wards. And it provides an analysis of pathways to reinstating STRs, through by-law, form-based and alternative methods, with distinctive focus on primary and secondary residences.**
